channel.title: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!
channel.description:
Hi all, I'm getting really fed up with my source, i go into both of the player files and change the welcome message compile it then log in and the same god damn message is there after i compile I've spent hour's searching the whole source folder and nothing else has the welcome message in it except those player files(which now have my own welcome message).
Please tell me how to fix this asap thank you,

item.title: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!
item.dc:creator: @fantom fantom
item.description:
@fantom wrote:

idk what ur talking about, fromt he compilier pic… it compiled fine. maybe u just did the codes wrong if there not working

Read full topic

item.title: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

I know for a fact it’s in IO as I’ve ran a 508 before, but I’m not exactly sure where the welcome message is allocated. Use if present the search button in the IO folder and type the welcome message or phrases of it.

Read full topic
item.source: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!

item.title: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!
item.dc:creator: @pepsitothemax pepsitothemax
item.description:
@pepsitothemax wrote:

durial it’s not character files but thank’s anyway,
kizbits2000, The source is called rule12 The folder’s i have are:
Bin-The runserver.bat and the compiler
Build-data and net
Src- has, net then com then codeusa then that has folders:
Clanchat
io
model
net
npcs
test
util
world
and 2 notepad files: Engine and Server

here is the two bits i edited that had the welcome message in them:

vs1doo.jpg955×628

9098b4.jpg955×628

almost forgot the compiler print screen it look’s fine)

Read full topic

item.title: Rule12 source welcome message wont change!
item.dc:creator: @Kizbits2000 Kizbits2000
item.description:
@Kizbits2000 wrote:

[ul]A bit more info please?

  • What source are you using?
  • What folders do you have?
  • A screen print of were you are editing it…
  • What does it say upon compiling?[/li][/ul]

Post those and people may be able to help a bit more :).

Thanks

Kiz

Read full topic
